trans-unit.source: Code Sample: OAuth 2.0 Certificate Authentication
trans-unit.target: Code Sample: OAuth 2.0 Certificate Authentication

trans-unit.source: Azure
trans-unit.target: Azure

trans-unit.source: Code Sample: OAuth 2.0 Certificate Authentication
trans-unit.target: Code Sample: OAuth 2.0 Certificate Authentication

trans-unit.source: This sample illustrates how to authenticate to <token>firstref_acs</token> using the OAuth 2.0 protocol by presenting a SAML token signed by an X.509 certificate.
trans-unit.target: This sample illustrates how to authenticate to <token>firstref_acs</token> using the OAuth 2.0 protocol by presenting a SAML token signed by an X.509 certificate.

trans-unit.source: This certificate corresponds to a ServiceIdentity configured on <token>secondref_acs</token>, and <token>secondref_acs</token> issues a SWT with a <newTerm>nameidentifier</newTerm> claim of the ServiceIdentity.
trans-unit.target: This certificate corresponds to a ServiceIdentity configured on <token>secondref_acs</token>, and <token>secondref_acs</token> issues a SWT with a <newTerm>nameidentifier</newTerm> claim of the ServiceIdentity.

trans-unit.source: This SWT is used to authenticate to an OAuth 2.0 protected resource.
trans-unit.target: This SWT is used to authenticate to an OAuth 2.0 protected resource.

trans-unit.source: This sample conforms to draft 13 of the OAuth 2.0 protocol.
trans-unit.target: This sample conforms to draft 13 of the OAuth 2.0 protocol.

trans-unit.source: The code for this sample is located in the OAuth2 (C#\OAuth2) subdirectory of the <token>ad_acs_code_gallery</token> package.
trans-unit.target: The code for this sample is located in the OAuth2 (C#\OAuth2) subdirectory of the <token>ad_acs_code_gallery</token> package.

trans-unit.source: Prerequisites
trans-unit.target: Prerequisites

trans-unit.source: To run this sample, you will need:
trans-unit.target: To run this sample, you will need:

trans-unit.source: An account in the Azure portal and an <token>ad_acs_namespace</token>.
trans-unit.target: An account in the Azure portal and an <token>ad_acs_namespace</token>.

trans-unit.source: <token>vs2010</token> (any version)
trans-unit.target: <token>vs2010</token> (any version)

trans-unit.source: For more details, see <externalLink><linkText>ACS Prerequisites</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=221065</linkUri></externalLink> (http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=221065).
trans-unit.target: For more details, see <externalLink><linkText>ACS Prerequisites</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=221065</linkUri></externalLink> (http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=221065).

trans-unit.source: Configuring the Sample
trans-unit.target: Configuring the Sample

trans-unit.source: The <token>secondref_acs</token> configuration required for this sample can be performed using either the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Portal or the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Service.
trans-unit.target: The <token>secondref_acs</token> configuration required for this sample can be performed using either the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Portal or the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Service.

trans-unit.source: This topic describes both options.
trans-unit.target: This topic describes both options.

trans-unit.source: Option 1: Configuring the Sample Using the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Portal
trans-unit.target: Option 1: Configuring the Sample Using the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Portal

trans-unit.source: Option 2: Configuring the Sample Using the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Service
trans-unit.target: Option 2: Configuring the Sample Using the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Service

trans-unit.source: Option 1: Configuring the Sample Using the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Portal
trans-unit.target: Option 1: Configuring the Sample Using the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Portal

trans-unit.source: To configure the sample using the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Portal
trans-unit.target: To configure the sample using the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Portal

trans-unit.source: This action opens the Access Control Service management portal.
trans-unit.target: This action opens the Access Control Service management portal.

trans-unit.source: To register your application with <token>secondref_acs</token>, click <ui>Relying party applications</ui>, click <ui>Add</ui>, and then type the following information in the form:
trans-unit.target: To register your application with <token>secondref_acs</token>, click <ui>Relying party applications</ui>, click <ui>Add</ui>, and then type the following information in the form:

trans-unit.source: In the <ui>Name</ui> field, enter <ui>OAuth2 RP</ui>
trans-unit.target: In the <ui>Name</ui> field, enter <ui>OAuth2 RP</ui>

trans-unit.source: In the <ui>Realm</ui> field, enter <ui>https://oauth2relyingparty/</ui>
trans-unit.target: In the <ui>Realm</ui> field, enter <ui>https://oauth2relyingparty/</ui>

trans-unit.source: In the <ui>Token format</ui> field, select <ui>SWT</ui>
trans-unit.target: In the <ui>Token format</ui> field, select <ui>SWT</ui>

trans-unit.source: Click <ui>Generate</ui> to create a new key
trans-unit.target: Click <ui>Generate</ui> to create a new key

trans-unit.source: In the <ui>Expiration Date</ui> field, enter an appropriate expiration date for the key.
trans-unit.target: In the <ui>Expiration Date</ui> field, enter an appropriate expiration date for the key.

trans-unit.source: The key will no longer be valid on this date.
trans-unit.target: The key will no longer be valid on this date.

trans-unit.source: Click <ui>Save</ui>.
trans-unit.target: Click <ui>Save</ui>.

trans-unit.source: With your relying party registered, it is now time to create the rules that determine the claims that <token>secondref_acs</token> will issue to your application.
trans-unit.target: With your relying party registered, it is now time to create the rules that determine the claims that <token>secondref_acs</token> will issue to your application.

trans-unit.source: In this sample, we will create a rule that grants any claim generated by <token>secondref_acs</token> to pass through.
trans-unit.target: In this sample, we will create a rule that grants any claim generated by <token>secondref_acs</token> to pass through.

trans-unit.source: To create this rule, click <ui>Rule Groups</ui>, and then click <ui>Default Rule Group for OAuth2 RP</ui>.
trans-unit.target: To create this rule, click <ui>Rule Groups</ui>, and then click <ui>Default Rule Group for OAuth2 RP</ui>.

trans-unit.source: Use the following settings to add a new rule:
trans-unit.target: Use the following settings to add a new rule:

trans-unit.source: In the <ui>Claim issuer</ui> section, select <ui>Access Control Service</ui>
trans-unit.target: In the <ui>Claim issuer</ui> section, select <ui>Access Control Service</ui>

trans-unit.source: In the <ui>Input claim type</ui> section, select <ui>Any</ui>
trans-unit.target: In the <ui>Input claim type</ui> section, select <ui>Any</ui>

trans-unit.source: In the <ui>Input claim value</ui> section, select <ui>Any</ui>
trans-unit.target: In the <ui>Input claim value</ui> section, select <ui>Any</ui>

trans-unit.source: In the <ui>Output claim type</ui> section, select <ui>Pass through input claim type</ui>
trans-unit.target: In the <ui>Output claim type</ui> section, select <ui>Pass through input claim type</ui>

trans-unit.source: In the <ui>Output claim value</ui> section, select <ui>Pass through input claim value</ui>
trans-unit.target: In the <ui>Output claim value</ui> section, select <ui>Pass through input claim value</ui>

trans-unit.source: This sample relies on credentials managed by <token>secondref_acs</token>.
trans-unit.target: This sample relies on credentials managed by <token>secondref_acs</token>.

trans-unit.source: To configure a new client certificate for the client application, click <ui>Service Identities</ui>, click <ui>Add</ui>, and then type a name.
trans-unit.target: To configure a new client certificate for the client application, click <ui>Service Identities</ui>, click <ui>Add</ui>, and then type a name.

trans-unit.source: Add a Credential Type of <ui>X.509 Certificate</ui> and browse for the <ui>ACS2ClientCertificate.cer</ui> file in the Certificates folder of this sample.
trans-unit.target: Add a Credential Type of <ui>X.509 Certificate</ui> and browse for the <ui>ACS2ClientCertificate.cer</ui> file in the Certificates folder of this sample.

trans-unit.source: Click <ui>Save</ui>.
trans-unit.target: Click <ui>Save</ui>.

trans-unit.source: Now that <token>secondref_acs</token> is configured, open <token>vs_current_short</token>.
trans-unit.target: Now that <token>secondref_acs</token> is configured, open <token>vs_current_short</token>.

trans-unit.source: Option 2: Configuring the Sample Using the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Service
trans-unit.target: Option 2: Configuring the Sample Using the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Service

trans-unit.source: The <token>vs_current_short</token> sample solution has a console application called <ui>ConfigureSample</ui> that uses the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Service and the common helpers defined in the <ui>Common</ui> class library.
trans-unit.target: The <token>vs_current_short</token> sample solution has a console application called <ui>ConfigureSample</ui> that uses the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Service and the common helpers defined in the <ui>Common</ui> class library.

trans-unit.source: This application can be used to configure your <token>ad_acs_namespace</token> for use with this sample.
trans-unit.target: This application can be used to configure your <token>ad_acs_namespace</token> for use with this sample.

trans-unit.source: To configure the sample using the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Service
trans-unit.target: To configure the sample using the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Service

trans-unit.source: Update the <ui>Common</ui> class library with information about your <token>ad_acs_namespace</token>.
trans-unit.target: Update the <ui>Common</ui> class library with information about your <token>ad_acs_namespace</token>.

trans-unit.source: Open <ui>SamplesConfiguration.cs</ui> and enter the following:
trans-unit.target: Open <ui>SamplesConfiguration.cs</ui> and enter the following:

trans-unit.source: <ui>ServiceNamespace</ui> - This is the name of your <token>ad_acs_namespace</token>
trans-unit.target: <ui>ServiceNamespace</ui> - This is the name of your <token>ad_acs_namespace</token>

trans-unit.source: <ui>ManagementServiceIdentityName</ui> - This is a management service account’s name
trans-unit.target: <ui>ManagementServiceIdentityName</ui> - This is a management service account’s name

trans-unit.source: <ui>ManagementServiceIdentityKey</ui> - This is the password associated with the management service account
trans-unit.target: <ui>ManagementServiceIdentityKey</ui> - This is the password associated with the management service account

trans-unit.source: <ui>AcsHostUrl</ui> - This is the host name of <token>secondref_acs</token>
trans-unit.target: <ui>AcsHostUrl</ui> - This is the host name of <token>secondref_acs</token>

trans-unit.source: Run the <ui>ConfigureSample</ui> application in <token>vs_current_short</token>.
trans-unit.target: Run the <ui>ConfigureSample</ui> application in <token>vs_current_short</token>.

trans-unit.source: This will configure <token>secondref_acs</token> to run this sample.
trans-unit.target: This will configure <token>secondref_acs</token> to run this sample.

trans-unit.source: When the <ui>ConfigureSample</ui> application completes, it will output the generated relying party signing key to the console.
trans-unit.target: When the <ui>ConfigureSample</ui> application completes, it will output the generated relying party signing key to the console.

trans-unit.source: Copy this key to the clipboard.
trans-unit.target: Copy this key to the clipboard.

trans-unit.source: Running the Sample
trans-unit.target: Running the Sample

trans-unit.source: To run the sample
trans-unit.target: To run the sample

trans-unit.source: Open the sample in <token>vs_current_short</token>.
trans-unit.target: Open the sample in <token>vs_current_short</token>.

trans-unit.source: In addition to <ui>ConfigureSample</ui> and <ui>Common</ui>, the solution consists of two projects: <ui>ProtectedResourceWebApp</ui> and <ui>Client</ui>.
trans-unit.target: In addition to <ui>ConfigureSample</ui> and <ui>Common</ui>, the solution consists of two projects: <ui>ProtectedResourceWebApp</ui> and <ui>Client</ui>.

trans-unit.source: If you have not already done so, enter your <token>ad_acs_namespace</token> details in <ui>Common\SamplesConfiguration.cs</ui>.
trans-unit.target: If you have not already done so, enter your <token>ad_acs_namespace</token> details in <ui>Common\SamplesConfiguration.cs</ui>.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see step 1 of <ui>Option 2: Configuring via the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Service</ui> above.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see step 1 of <ui>Option 2: Configuring via the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Service</ui> above.

trans-unit.source: This file is also used by the <ui>Client</ui> project.
trans-unit.target: This file is also used by the <ui>Client</ui> project.

trans-unit.source: Open the <ui>web.config</ui> file in the <ui>ProtectedResourceWebApp</ui> project.
trans-unit.target: Open the <ui>web.config</ui> file in the <ui>ProtectedResourceWebApp</ui> project.

trans-unit.source: Enter your token signing key in the appropriate AppSettings elements.
trans-unit.target: Enter your token signing key in the appropriate AppSettings elements.

trans-unit.source: If you used the Management Service to configure <token>secondref_acs</token>, this is the value that you copied to the clipboard.
trans-unit.target: If you used the Management Service to configure <token>secondref_acs</token>, this is the value that you copied to the clipboard.

trans-unit.source: To obtain the token signing key, in the <token>secondref_acs</token> portal, click <ui>Certificates and Keys</ui>.
trans-unit.target: To obtain the token signing key, in the <token>secondref_acs</token> portal, click <ui>Certificates and Keys</ui>.

trans-unit.source: Below is a code snippet that show this section of the web.config file:
trans-unit.target: Below is a code snippet that show this section of the web.config file:

trans-unit.source: To run the sample, start the <ui>ProtectedResourceWebApp</ui>.
trans-unit.target: To run the sample, start the <ui>ProtectedResourceWebApp</ui>.

trans-unit.source: A web browser appears, but the text box is empty because the web browser is unauthenticated.
trans-unit.target: A web browser appears, but the text box is empty because the web browser is unauthenticated.

trans-unit.source: Run <ui>Client</ui>.
trans-unit.target: Run <ui>Client</ui>.

trans-unit.source: HTML will be displayed in a console window.
trans-unit.target: HTML will be displayed in a console window.

trans-unit.source: Note that the HTML indicates that the user is authenticated and displays the claims from <token>secondref_acs</token>.
trans-unit.target: Note that the HTML indicates that the user is authenticated and displays the claims from <token>secondref_acs</token>.
